addons.name: Adblock Plus
addons.description:
Annoyed by adverts? Troubled by tracking? Bothered by banners? Install Adblock Plus now to regain control of the internet and change the way that you view the web.

A short video overview is available at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oNvb2SjVjjI
addons.fullDescription:
Adblock Plus allows you to regain control of the internet and view the web the way you want to. The add-on is supported by over forty filter subscriptions in dozens of languages which automatically configure it for purposes ranging from removing online advertising to blocking all known malware domains. Adblock Plus also allows you to customize your filters with the assistance of a variety of useful features, including a context option for images, a block tab for Flash and Java objects, and a list of blockable items to remove scripts and stylesheets.

Starting with Adblock Plus 2.0 there is an option in Filter Preferences to allow some non-intrusive advertising. The goal is to support websites using non-intrusive ways to advertise and to encourage more websites to do the same. Read more

addons.name: InlineDisposition
addons.description: InlineDisposition changes the disposition of Content-Disposition response headers from attachment to inline; this prevents servers from forcing the browser to save a file and allows that file to be viewed in the browser, if the browser supports it.
addons.fullDescription:
InlineDisposition changes the disposition type of Content-Disposition response headers from attachment to inline; this prevents servers from forcing the browser to save a file and allows that file to be viewed in the browser, if the browser supports it.

Normally, when the browser receives content from a web server, the browser decides whether to view that content in-browser or handle it externally (either by saving it or opening it in an external application) based on whether the browser is capable of internally handling the content and on the user's actions and preferences. However, through the use of the Content-Disposition HTTP header, websites can override this behavior and force the browser to handle the content externally, even if the browser is capable of displaying the content and even if that is not what the user wanted. By altering the disposition type of Content-Disposition response headers from attachment to inline, InlineDisposition restores user choice.

This does not mean that all content will be displayed inline in the browser: InlineDisposition simply restores the default behavior, so the browser will still save or externally open a file if it cannot view it or if the user requests that it be saved or externally opened. Only server-initiated saves are affected, and the user can still save a file at the user's own discretion.

InlineDisposition was created in response to my encounters with some websites that forced me to save documents and images that I would rather have viewed directly in the browser. I wanted to control when a file is saved and not have that be dictated to me by a website.

You can test InlineDisposition by opening this link.

Note: The server can still deny inline viewing of content by specifying a Content-Type that the browser cannot internally handle.

addons.name: Polish Spellchecker Dictionary
addons.description: Polish spell-check dictionary for Firefox 2.0/3.0pre, Thunderbird 2.0/3.0a1 and SeaMonkey 1.1/2.0a1...
addons.fullDescription: Polish spell-check dictionary for Firefox 2.0/3.0pre, Thunderbird 2.0/30a1 and SeaMonkey 1.1/2.0a1...
addons.developerComments:
This is a Polish dictionary for Firefox & Thunderbird's spell checker, based on SJP.pl's dictionary (by Marek Futrega et al.).

SJP.pl's dictionary itself is available at: http://www.sjp.pl/
addons.eula:
This dictionary for spell-checking Polish texts is licensed under GPL 2.0, LGPL 2.0 and MPL 1.1 (Mozilla Public License). You can use this extension for any commercial and personal purposes. For details about the GPL and LGPL licenses see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html, for details about MPL: http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/

This extension contains dictionary files created by the SJP.pl team, under Marek Futrega's (futrega@gmail.com) supervision.

Firefox/Thunderbird extension maintainer: Marek Stepien (mstepien@aviary.pl)

addons.name: Hide Tab Bar With One Tab
addons.description: Hide the tab bar if there is only one tab.
addons.fullDescription:
Hide the tab bar if there is only one tab. Automatically sets browser.tabs.drawInTitlebar to false and gives the option to reset it to default on uninstalling/disabling. (no longer happens as of 1.2beta.)

I did not realize posting the beta would push it out to everyone. With a fully reviewed extension, that does not happen. 1.2beta broke the close button. It should be fixed in beta2. That should show up automatically in a few hours/days or you can get it by clicking on "Version Information" and the Version 1.2beta link at the bottom of the add-ons page here. Now beta3 - fixes a css selector error in beta2 that threw an error but should have worked correctly anyway.

addons.name: No Caption
addons.fullDescription:
This extension removes the titlebar, making more space on the screen.
This is useful for small screens, such as netbooks.

In Firefox under Windows XP it is desirable to enable the menu forever, or have access to menu through pressing Alt.
addons.developerComments:
Version without bootstrap.
Work on Firefox version 3.x+
On Linux and SeaMonkey this version works better.
The buttons are made as toolbars, they can be installed at any location on the panel.

Download version without bootstrap

addons.name: Hide Caption Titlebar Plus
addons.description: "Maximize your screen space by controlling the presence of Firefox window Title-bar (Caption) & borders!", to be like Chrome Browser. - Hide FF's caption with 'smart' options, *optional* custom caption & resizers. - Works with ChromiFox-like themes.
addons.fullDescription:
* Breaking News: *

      Thunderbird version is available now! (Windows only)
      New version 2.7.2 available , with workaround to fully work again in Firefox 12 & up!


 
* These descriptions still needs updating of new functionality since Firefox 4: *

    The main source of features info is the addon's Options/Preferences dialog, with many tooltips and descriptions. (accessible also from the context-menu mentioned below.)
    There is a Context-Menu (mouse secondary-button-click) accesible from Fx main button, Max,Min&Close buttons and Drag-Window control, for opening Options dialog.
    Works and looks good with ChromiFox basic theme, and also with ChromiFox Extreme, Cfx Extreme CARBON, Strata40/StrataBuddy. (theme tips in readme).
     
    Compatible with all utility addons that I could test so far. Ie.: Tab Mix Plus, Tab Kit.




** About Firefox 12 or later issue: Disabled Customizable-Min,Max,Close-buttons ** (Windows OS)

    On 2012-01-15 was changed a needed Firefox capability that allows addons like HCTP to have customizable Min,Max,Close Buttons in Windows Glass desktops, that I still hope to be fixed sometime soon.
     Update!: New version 2.7.1 finally has workarounds for this!.
    FYI: In options dialog (where customizable buttons are configured), has a red-text warning about this condition. Also, this problem don't affect you if "Show Firefox 4+ Titlebar" is setted to "enabled" (of course losing some space).

        I've filed Firefox Bug 730219 on 2012-02-24 about this.
        This is discussed already in the Support Site, Issue 178.




    --> Bug/Issue reports are welcomed in the Support site. Please don't post them in a Review here. (Also, please don't report download errors, they are not caused by the addon, but by one of the many download mirrors of this site.)

    I's recommended (and very easy) to test any issue by opening a new Firefox window with a blank (fresh) profile! (You can leave open the main Firefox window, that wont be affected at all). Very useful to identify addons incompatibilities.

    Simply run this command:
      firefox.exe -no-remote -profile "c:\_Firefox_temp_profile"

        Having another Fx window with a fresh profile can also be useful to try at will this and other addons without interfering with your main Fx window. (Just in case, more info here: "Opening New instance of Firefox with another profile" )


    (Please note that in Mac OSX there are mixed reports about hiding the caption)

    Check the Development Channel below for a possible newer version with last fixes! If found, you can check It's Release Notes in 'See complete version history' link.

screenshots.caption: Maximizing Content Space!  (Self explaining. All options are configurable)

addons.name: R-kiosk
addons.description: Real Kiosk is a Firefox extension that defaults to full screen, disables all menus, toolbars, key commands and right button menus. Alt+Home still takes you home. ...
addons.eula:
R-Kiosk extension is in public domain. It may be freely reproduced, distributed, transmitted, used, modified, built upon, or otherwise used by anyone for commercial or non-commercial purposes.

R-Kiosk extension is supplied as is. You use this extension at your own risk.
